ygData.subject: Re: Mechanics of making 60 pp an hour.
ygData.msgSnippet: Here s my method... You need 42 free slots (20 sketches, 20 flasks of water, 40 blocks of clay = 42 slots.) 2 regular inventory slots are used for flasks and
ygData.messageBody:
Here's my method...

You need 42 free slots (20 sketches, 20 flasks of water, 40 blocks of clay =
42 slots.) 2 regular inventory slots are used for flasks and sketches. the
other slots are my 6 packs (total 48 free slots). I add my pottery book and
7 different types of food, including water (being a ranger that's usually
berries, grapes, vegetables, roots, pig meat, pods of water, fishing grubs
and muffins). Leaving 40 slots for clay.

That way I can buy clay with impunity and not have to worry about buying too
much.

Graedon
-----Original Message-----
From: Scott Wilcox [mailto:Scott.Wilcox@...]
Sent: Thursday, July 08, 1999 4:04 PM
To: EQ_Potters
Subject: [EQ_Potters] Mechanics of making 60 pp an hour.


From: Scott Wilcox <Scott.Wilcox@...>

All,

I am a halfling who has spent most of his potting days in Halas. I am a
master with a skill of 113 and have been spending most of my time on pie
tins. At the best, I can make 15-20 pp an hour. Do you have any tips on
how many of each item you buy per round, etc? I can't fathom being able
to make that much pp in an hour.

Thanks for any help,

Jhyvar
